N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2815.1 - Contracts

State Regulations
(a) Rural
preservation program contracts shall: (1)
be
for a period of one year, but may be renewed or extended at the discretion of
the commissioner; (2)
define the
region or portion thereof within which the housing preservation and community
renewal activities shall be performed; and
(3)
include the following items: (i) general goals in effecting rural
preservation, stabilization or improvement; (ii)
quantified, measurable objectives to be
accomplished by the completion of the activities proposed in the work
plan; (iii)
financial plan
including budget specifying the use of funds from the division, other financial
resources, including the one-third match requirement and staffing
pattern; (iv)
a plan for securing
funds from other sources, for administrative and planning costs. (b) Contracts shall be
limited in amount to the sum of $100,000 in a single year and to the aggregate
sum of $650,000 for a single rural preservation company, provided that in any
year in which the aggregate sum of $3,000 shall have been reached and all
succeeding years, the annual contract shall be subject to a limit of $65,000
per year. Notes
